title: Birds with a mission: Sweden's crows clean up cigarette butts for food
'Trump mocks his own supporters off-camera': Stephanie Grisham slams former boss at Democratic Convention
content: Former Trump Press Secretary Stephanie Grisham criticized Donald Trump during the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. Grisham condemned Trump's lack of morals and his treatment of supporters. She revealed that her decision to resign was influenced by Melania Trump's refusal to denounce violence after the Capitol riots. Grisham endorsed Kamala Harris, urging GOP voters to prevent Trump's return.
summary: Former Trump Press Secretary Stephanie Grisham criticized Donald Trump during the Democratic National Convention in Chicago. Grisham condemned Trump's lack of morals and his treatment of supporters. She revealed that her decision to resign was influenced by Melania Trump's refusal to denounce violence after the Capitol riots. Grisham endorsed Kamala Harris, urging GOP voters to prevent Trump's return.

title: 'Is Kamala a chameleon?': Hulk Hogan's racial jabs spark outrage as he suggests 'body-slamming' her
content: WWE legend Hulk Hogan, during a promotional event, made controversial remarks about US Vice President Kamala Harris, questioning her racial identity and jokingly suggesting body-slamming her. Hogan's comments attracted significant backlash, coinciding with the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, where key figures showed robust support for Harris as the Democratic presidential candidate.
summary: WWE legend Hulk Hogan, during a promotional event, made controversial remarks about US Vice President Kamala Harris, questioning her racial identity and jokingly suggesting body-slamming her. Hogan's comments attracted significant backlash, coinciding with the Democratic National Convention in Chicago, where key figures showed robust support for Harris as the Democratic presidential candidate.

title: World's 'largest solar precinct' approved by Australian government
content: The Australian government's environmental approval has advanced a $19 billion solar farm project by Sun Cable, aimed at transporting electricity from northern Australia to Singapore. This project, heralded as a renewable energy milestone, faced setbacks in early 2023 but is now progressing under Grok Ventures' ownership, with energy supply expected by the early 2030s.
summary: The Australian government's environmental approval has advanced a $19 billion solar farm project by Sun Cable, aimed at transporting electricity from northern Australia to Singapore. This project, heralded as a renewable energy milestone, faced setbacks in early 2023 but is now progressing under Grok Ventures' ownership, with energy supply expected by the early 2030s.

title: Deadly bus crash in Iran claims lives of 28 Pakistani Shiite pilgrims
Obama at DNC uses hand gesture to mock Trump’s obsession with crowd sizes: 'His weird obsession with ...'
content: At the Democratic National Convention, former President Barack Obama critiqued Donald Trump with humor, contrasting Trump's focus on personal issues with voters' concerns. Obama highlighted Trump's obsession with crowd sizes, using a hand gesture that amused the audience, and likened Trump's behavior to a bothersome neighbor. Obama argued for a new direction with Kamala Harris.
summary: At the Democratic National Convention, former President Barack Obama critiqued Donald Trump with humor, contrasting Trump's focus on personal issues with voters' concerns. Obama highlighted Trump's obsession with crowd sizes, using a hand gesture that amused the audience, and likened Trump's behavior to a bothersome neighbor. Obama argued for a new direction with Kamala Harris.

title: Barack Obama at DNC: ‘Time for a new chapter with Harris, not Trump’s chaos’
Michelle Obama: Who's going to tell Trump that the job he's seeking might be those 'black jobs'?
content: Michelle Obama delivered a potent speech at the DNC, criticizing former President Trump for his racially charged rhetoric and controversial comments. She praised Kamala Harris as one of the most qualified presidential candidates and called on Americans to stand up for basic freedoms and decency. Her message aimed to inspire hope amidst uncertainty.
summary: Michelle Obama delivered a potent speech at the DNC, criticizing former President Trump for his racially charged rhetoric and controversial comments. She praised Kamala Harris as one of the most qualified presidential candidates and called on Americans to stand up for basic freedoms and decency. Her message aimed to inspire hope amidst uncertainty.

title: 'America, hope is making a comeback': Michelle Obama at DNC
content: Michelle Obama made a noteworthy return to politics with a powerful speech at the Democratic National Convention. She subtly criticized former President Trump while endorsing Kamala Harris for the presidency, praising her exceptional qualifications. Michelle emphasized unity and hope, reminiscent of Barack Obama's campaigns, and energized the Democratic Party with her hopeful message.
summary: Michelle Obama made a noteworthy return to politics with a powerful speech at the Democratic National Convention. She subtly criticized former President Trump while endorsing Kamala Harris for the presidency, praising her exceptional qualifications. Michelle emphasized unity and hope, reminiscent of Barack Obama's campaigns, and energized the Democratic Party with her hopeful message.

BNP asks India to extradite PM Sheikh Hasina for trial in Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh's main opposition party, BNP, requested India to extradite former PM Sheikh Hasina to face charges of murder and other cases following her departure amid a student-led uprising. The BNP claimed that the charges are serious and fall under the extraditable category, urging India to uphold legal commitments under the bilateral treaty.
summary: Bangladesh's main opposition party, BNP, requested India to extradite former PM Sheikh Hasina to face charges of murder and other cases following her departure amid a student-led uprising. The BNP claimed that the charges are serious and fall under the extraditable category, urging India to uphold legal commitments under the bilateral treaty.
